SVGFEConvolveMatrixElement.summary: The SVGFEConvolveMatrixElement interface corresponds to the feConvolveMatrix element.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementEdgeMode.summary: The edgeMode read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("edgeMode")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element. The SVG_EDGEMODE_* constants defined on this interface are represented by the numbers 1 through 3, where the default duplicate is 1, wrap is 2, and none is 3.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementOrderY.summary: The orderY read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("order")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

remarks.para: It specifies how many cells (or elements) are present in each row of the kernel matrix along the Y-axis.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementWidth.summary: The width read-only property of the interface describes the horizontal size of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the feConvolveMatrix element's {{SVGAttr("width")}} filter primitive attribute. The <feConvolveMatrix> filter applies a matrix convolution effect, combining pixels in the input image with neighboring pixels to produce a convolution effect such as blurring, edge detection, sharpening, embossing or beveling. The attribute is a <length> or a <percentage> relative to the width of the filter region. The default value is 100%. The property value is a length in user coordinate system units.

-
-CSS filter effects module
-SVG filter element, SVG {{SVGAttr("filter")}} attribute in SVG
-Applying SVG effects to HTML content

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementX.summary: The x read-only property of the interface describes the horizontal coordinate of the position of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the feConvolveMatrix element's {{SVGAttr("x")}} filter primitive attribute value. The <feConvolveMatrix> filter applies a matrix convolution effect, combining pixels in the input image with neighboring pixels to produce a convolution effect such as blurring, edge detection, sharpening, embossing or beveling. The attribute is a <length> or <percentage>. The <coordinate> is a length in the user coordinate system that is the given distance from the origin of the user coordinate system along the x-axis. If the x attribute is a percent value, the property value is relative to the width of the filter region in user coordinate system units. The default value is 0.

-
-CSS filter effects module
-SVG filter element, SVG {{SVGAttr("filter")}} attribute in SVG
-Applying SVG effects to HTML content

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementOrderX.summary: The orderX read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("order")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

remarks.para: It specifies how many cells (or elements) are present in each row of the kernel matrix along the X-axis.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementTargetX.summary: The targetX read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("targetX")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementTargetY.summary: The targetY read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("targetY")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementDivisor.summary: The divisor read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("divisor")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementHeight.summary: The height read-only property of the interface describes the vertical size of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the feConvolveMatrix element's {{SVGAttr("height")}} filter primitive attribute. The <feConvolveMatrix> filter applies a matrix convolution effect, combining pixels in the input image with neighboring pixels to produce a convolution effect such as blurring, edge detection, sharpening, embossing or beveling. The attribute is a <length> or a <percentage> relative to the height of the filter region. The default value is 100%. The property value is a length in user coordinate system units.

-
-CSS filter effects module
-SVG filter element, SVG {{SVGAttr("filter")}} attribute in SVG
-Applying SVG effects to HTML content

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementKernelUnitLeng.summary: The kernelUnitLengthY read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("kernelUnitLength")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

remarks.para: It specifies the length in user units for each cell of the convolution matrix along the Y-axis.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementBias.summary: The bias read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("bias")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementPreserveAlpha.summary: The preserveAlpha read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("preserveAlpha")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementKernelUnitLeng.summary: The kernelUnitLengthX read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("kernelUnitLength")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

remarks.para: It specifies the length in user units for each cell of the convolution matrix along the X-axis.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementResult.summary: The result read-only property of the interface describes the assigned name of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the feConvolveMatrix element's {{SVGAttr("result")}} attribute. The <feConvolveMatrix> filter applies a matrix convolution effect, combining pixels in the input image with neighboring pixels to produce a convolution effect such as blurring, edge detection, sharpening, embossing or beveling.

The attribute value is a custom-ident. If supplied, then graphics that result from processing this filter primitive can be referenced by an {{SVGAttr("in")}} attribute on a subsequent filter primitive within the same {{SVGElement("filter")}} element.

If no result attribute is defined, the filter's result.baseVal and result.animVal are empty strings, and the output of the <feConvolveMatrix> filter will only be available for re-use as the implicit input into the next filter primitive if that filter primitive provides no value for its in attribute.

-
-custom-ident data type
-CSS filter effects module
-SVG filter element, SVG {{SVGAttr("filter")}} attribute in SVG
-Applying SVG effects to HTML content

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementIn1.summary: The in1 read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("in")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementKernelMatrix.summary: The kernelMatrix read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("kernelMatrix")}} attribute of the given {{SVGElement("feConvolveMatrix")}} element.

SVGFEConvolveMatrixElementY.summary: The y read-only property of the interface describes the vertical coordinate of the position of an SVG filter primitive as a .

remarks.para: It reflects the feConvolveMatrix element's {{SVGAttr("y")}} filter primitive attribute value. The <feConvolveMatrix> filter applies a matrix convolution effect, combining pixels in the input image with neighboring pixels to produce a convolution effect such as blurring, edge detection, sharpening, embossing or beveling.

The attribute is a <length> or <percentage>. The <coordinate> is a length in the user coordinate system that is the given distance from the origin of the filter along the y-axis. If the y attribute is a percent value, the property value is a relative to the height of the filter region in user coordinate system units. The default value is 0.

-
-CSS filter effects module
-SVG filter element, SVG {{SVGAttr("filter")}} attribute in SVG
-Applying SVG effects to HTML content
